comments.body:
Sorry, forgot to mention this. It would be great if we start including the license file. The motivation being many open source licenses require that they appear with the code. MIT is definitely one of these licenses. To do this for `python-docx`, it is simply a matter of adding the following.

```
  license_file: LICENSE
```

It would be nice to have this done in the feedstock with a corresponding build number bump. That way new packages will include the license and thus be compliant.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +42,46 @@about:
  home: https://github.com/python-openxml/python-docx
  license: MIT
  summary: 'Create and update Microsoft Word .docx files.'
